H0.text: Transform boundary is the location where tectonic plate movement forms isolated volcanic islands, such as Hawaii.

H1.text: Divergent boundaries are the locations where the movement of tectonic plates forms isolated volcanic islands, such as Hawaii.

H2.text: Subduction zone is the location where the movement of tectonic plates forms isolated volcanic islands, such as Hawaii.

H3.text: Hot spots are the locations where the movement of tectonic plates forms isolated volcanic islands, such as Hawaii.

A4.text: Hotspots are volcanic locales thought to be fed by underlying mantle that is anomalously hot compared with the surrounding mantle.

A5.text: This plate, as it is subducted, releases water into the base of the over-riding plate, and this water mixes with the rock, thus changing its composition causing some rock to melt and rise, and it is this that fuels a chain of volcanoes, such as the Aleutian Islands, near Alaska.

A6.text: The Hawai ªi hotspot is located far from plate boundaries.

A7.text: A 2024 study shows low velocity seismic zones beneath the Island of Hawaii at depths of 80-150 kilometers.
